value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Introduction to DAX Studio - By Darren Gosbell
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Darren Gosbell the creator of DAX Studio will be giving a live demo of his tool.    In this webinar we will be reviewing the following topics:  - What is DAX Studio?  - Why should I use DAX Studio?  - Getting started and connecting DAX Studio to various

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Model Performance Tuning in DAX Studio - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Model Performance Tuning. value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Measures vs. calculated columns in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: What are the differences between measures and calculated columns in DAX and Power BI? All the answers in this short video. Do you want to know more? value.title: Add calculated tables and columns to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to add calculated tables and calculated columns to your data model. You'll also be able to describe row context, which is used to evaluated calculated column formulas. Because it's possible to add columns to a table using Power Query, you'll also learn when it's best to create calculated columns instead of Power Query computed columns.

value.title: Bulk import data from multiple pages on a website with Power BI Desktop - Power BI Tips & Tricks #04
value.excerpt: Have you come across a website that has data you need but it is presented in multiple pages? Downloading page by page can be frustrating and time consuming. In this short video, I will show you how to iterate multiple pages on a website to import the data using Power BI.
